summary: The Made in America Manufacturing Finance Act of 2025 aims to increase loan limits for small manufacturers. The bill defines a "small manufacturer" based on NAICS codes (31, 32, or 33) and the location of production facilities within the U.S. It amends the Small Business Act and the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to allow for higher loan amounts for these businesses, particularly in sections related to general loans and export financing. The bill intends to provide financial support to grow and develop manufacturing within America.
